page.title: 09'The Countryman' Magazine.
page.content: BÂ£The Countryman' is a quarterly magazine edited in Burford by Christopher Hall.It is taken by 81000 people.Articles are sent in about the countryside, animals, birds, flowers and different parts of Britain.Chris Hall sorts these out and selects suitable poems and illustrations for the magazine.The writers are usually different for each issue.The magazine is available in newsagents or by annual subscription.Few children or very young people take the magazine,but it retains its readership and copies are sent abroad.The business started in 1927 and the copies are printed in Luton using photocomposition machinery. The format has changed in the last forty years,but Chris Hall thinks it will keep its present design during the next few years.
